result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin Joseph Pitzo

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Benjamin Joseph Pitzo in court, in custody.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden in court for Benjamin Joseph Pitzo.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.  Court began plea colloquy with the defendant.  Court does not find the guilty pleas appropriate.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum
Received and Filed: Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Received and Filed:  State's Offer Letter
Received and Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Attorney Andrew Golden notified the Court he would be unable to appear for the hearing. Judge Shelton authorizied Defense contact Clerk via email to schedule a new Plea/Sentencing hearing date. Clerk contacted both parties and new date was selected. Defendant Benjamin Joseph Pitzo not in court. Case remains calendared in Branch 40 with Defendant's other case 21CF2385.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Andrew Joel Golden in court, defendant Benjamin Joseph Pitzo not in court, in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference.  Defense is waiting on discovery and requests another status date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court rescheduled status date scheduled on July 12, 2022 at 1:30 pm.  Next court date is on July 13, 2022 at 1:30 pm for a status in Branch 40.  Parties notified of next court date.

Defendant Benjamin Joseph Pitzo in court by video with Attorney Andrew Joel Golden who appears in person.  Defendant Benjamin Joseph Pitzo in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed:  Attorney Andrew Golden

Defendant Benjamin Joseph Pitzo not in court, defendant in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Benjamin Joseph Pitzo not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for preliminary hearing.  State's witness is present. SPD did not appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Benjamin Joseph Pitzo in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Benjamin Joseph Pitzo in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Benjamin Joseph Pitzo appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has lower number case(s) pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Denis B. and co-defs: DETTMAN and KING
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
